intro: Mendoncia splitgerberiana, commonly known as the Splitgerberian lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant features strap-like leaves that are often variegated with white and green markings. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
